title: Achilles Tendinopathy in a Recreational Runner
clinical_history: A 35-year-old male recreational runner presents with a 6-week history of right ankle pain. He reports a gradual onset of pain in the Achilles tendon region, which started as a mild ache after running and has progressed to a sharp pain during and after running. He has been running 3 times a week for the past year, with a recent increase in mileage. He also reports stiffness in the morning that improves with activity.
aggrevating_factors: running, especially uphill or on uneven terrain; jumping; hopping; and prolonged standing
picture: The patient reports a 24-hour pain picture that is typically worse in the morning (7/10) and improves throughout the day, but returns to 4/10 by the evening.
past_history: Previous ankle sprain 2 years ago; has a history of overuse injuries in the past
medical_history: generally healthy; takes no regular medications
personal_history: married; works as an accountant; enjoys running and hiking in his free time
imaging: Ultrasound of the right Achilles tendon shows tendinosis with some thickening of the tendon
